page.title: 01BRINKWORTH VILLAGE
page.content: Brinkworth is situated on the B4042 with Swindon, fastest growing town in Europe, lying to the east of Malmersbury, one of the oldest boroughs is England to the west. Brinkworth is the longest village in Wiltshire, 4.2 miles from boudary post to boundary post, encompassin 6,075 acres, predominantly farmland. Population by the 1981 census is 1,191. Due to close proximity to access points to M4, many residents commute daily to Bristol, London and of course Swindon to their employment. Premier points of interest are St. Michaels Church, built on the site of a former Norman Churchland with a history dating back to 14th century; Famous for its Methodist Circuit, the first Chapel being built in 1828; Brinkworth County Primary School was opened in 1868 as Brinkworth National
